item.title: Why I moved from WordPress to GitHub Pages
item.description: In the beginning… A few weeks before I had this website, I decided to open a blog. I Googled “how to create a blog”, and WordPress came up as a clear winner. I created an account, and got started pretty easy. I created a post, and got thrown to the block editor. It’s a WYSIWYG editor, which uses “blocks” as a way to define data and its properties. For example, one block can be a paragraph, the next one is a quote, and the next is an image.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi! I’m Barak Nehmad. Who? I’m an independent InfoSec enthusaist. Where? Here’s my Twitter (DMs always open) Over there on the left side is my GitHub If you look over to the right it’s my e-mail Why? I wanted to document my InfoSec and wargames escapades, for a few reasons: Learning - By documenting what I’m doing, I can rubber duck debug myself, and get feedback from whoever’s reading my posts.

item.title: Narnia Writeup
item.description: Intro BUT FIRST - SPOILER WARNING! Narnia0 –> Narnia1 Narnia1 –> Narnia2 Narnia2 –> Narnia3 Narnia3 –> Narnia4 Narnia4 –> Narnia5 Intro So, I’ve decided to try doing the Narnia wargame, and document my attempts. Let’s get started! BUT FIRST - SPOILER WARNING! Do not read this writeup if you plan to solve Narnia yourself! Narnia0 –> Narnia1 First, we log in: ssh -p 2226 narnia0@narnia.labs.overthewire.org With the password narnia0.
